title: Szechuan Beef Recipe
description: This Szechuan beef features sliced sirloin marinated in garlicky, spicy soy sauce, then stir-fried with broccoli, onion, water chestnuts, and peanuts.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Szechuan Beef 3.8 (177) 134 Reviews 31 Photos This Szechuan beef is spicy! Serve with rice. By Allrecipes Member Updated on May 30, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 tablespoon soy sauce 2 teaspoons cornstarch 1 clove garlic, minced ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper 1 pound sirloin steak, cut into bite-sized strips 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 3 cups fresh broccoli florets 2 small onions, cut into wedges 1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained ¼ cup chicken broth ½ cup peanuts Directions Stir together soy sauce, cornstarch, garlic, and crushed red pepper in a non-metal bowl. Add steak and toss to coat. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry beef in hot oil until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add broccoli, onions, and water chestnuts; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in broth and bring to a boil. Stir in peanuts; cook for 1 minute and serve hot. I Made It Print 267 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 306 Calories 21g Fat 13g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 306 % Daily Value * Total Fat 21g 27% Saturated Fat 5g 27% Cholesterol 44mg 15% Sodium 243mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 13g 5% Dietary Fiber 4g 13% Total Sugars 3g Protein 18g 36% Vitamin C 43mg 48% Calcium 46mg 4% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 501mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Szechuan Beef 01 of 31 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 31 Photo by  Felipe Morales 10/03/2020 I substituted the watercrest with a cup of sliced red and green bell peppers. (1/2 of each pepper). Also, I only used 1/4 cup of peanuts I chopped up corsley. I served it on top of a rice medley from trader joe's with Brown rice, Red Rice and Black barley. I stir fried a cup of frozen peas and carrots in a tablespoon of sesame oil with a sprinkle of ground ginger and black pepper then added the rice. 03 of 31 Photo by  mkm 01/06/2020 This has become a family favorite at my house. I sometimes alter it a bit - using cashews instead of peanuts or green beans instead of broccoli - and I always add some sriracha as it is not spicy enough for my personal taste as written. I usually serve over stir-fry noodles or steamed rice. Delicious! 04 of 31 Photo by  mkm 01/06/2020 This has become a family favorite at my house. I sometimes alter it a bit - using cashews instead of peanuts or green beans instead of broccoli - and I always add some sriracha as it is not spicy enough for my personal taste as written. I usually serve over stir-fry noodles or steamed rice. Delicious! 05 of 31 Photo by  NycklsB 01/03/2020 06 of 31 Photo by  Hannah Glover 06/17/2019 07 of 31 Photo by  Florine Chan 02/27/2019 08 of 31 Photo by  Jenny Wenny 01/19/2019 09 of 31 Photo by  Sarah Sonnenberg 10/12/2017 10 of 31 Photo by  Bonita Gillespie Labb 09/17/2017 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Orange Peel Beef 56 Ratings Beef with Vegetables 91 Ratings Crispy Orange Beef 1,066 Ratings Chinese Pepper Steak 1,069 Ratings Super-Simple, Super-Spicy Mongolian Beef 465 Ratings Jamey's Restaurant Style Beef and Broccoli 48 Ratings Beef Lo Mein 175 Ratings Asian Beef with Snow Peas 1,346 Ratings Japanese Beef Stir-Fry 274 Ratings Mongolian Beef and Spring Onions 1,194 Ratings Flavorful Beef Stir-Fry 157 Ratings Hot and Tangy Broccoli Beef 154 Ratings Black Pepper Beef and Cabbage Stir Fry 780 Ratings Spicy Orange Zest Beef 127 Ratings Sukiyaki 27 Ratings Szechuan Spicy Eggplant 186 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Allrecipes Member
instructions: Stir together soy sauce, cornstarch, garlic, and crushed red pepper in a non-metal bowl. Add steak and toss to coat. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 20 minutes.;Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry beef in hot oil until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add broccoli, onions, and water chestnuts; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in broth and bring to a boil. Stir in peanuts; cook for 1 minute and serve hot.
